modulesynopsis.name: mod_substitute
modulesynopsis.description: Perform search and replace operations on response bodies
modulesynopsis.compatibility: Available in Apache HTTP Server 2.2.7 and later

summary.p: mod_substitute provides a mechanism to perform both regular expression and fixed string substitutions on response bodies.

directivesynopsis.name: Substitute
directivesynopsis.description: Pattern to filter the response content

usage.p: The Substitute directive specifies a search and replace pattern to apply to the response body.
The meaning of the pattern can be modified by using any combination of these flags:

dl.dd: By default the pattern is treated as a regular expression. Using the n flag forces the pattern to be treated as a fixed string.
The f flag causes mod_substitute to flatten the result of a substitution allowing for later substitutions to take place on the boundary of this one. This is the default.

The q flag causes mod_substitute to not flatten the buckets after each substitution. This can result in much faster response and a decrease in memory utilization, but should only be used if there is no possibility that the result of one substitution will ever match a pattern or regex of a subsequent one.

usage.example:
Example <Location />
AddOutputFilterByType SUBSTITUTE text/html
Substitute s/foo/bar/ni
</Location>
usage.p: If either the pattern or the substitution contain a slash character then an alternative delimiter should be used:
usage.example:
Example of using an alternate delimiter AddOutputFilterByType SUBSTITUTE text/html Substitute "s|
|
|i"
